item.title: Developing for Screen Reader Users
item.description: NVDA is a free screen reader for Windows, which you can use for testing. Hiding non-interactive content from visible display, still read by screen readers # If you were to hide a link by setting display: none in the CSS then screen readers wouldnâ€™t find it. Instead, we position it absolutely, with clipping. CSS .offscreen { position: absolute; clip: rect(1px 1px 1px 1px); /* for Internet Explorer */ clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px); padding: 0; border: 0; height: 1px; width: 1px; overflow: hidden; }
